channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Nikkei jumps 3%, leading Asia-Pacific markets higher
item.description: The major benchmarks rebounded from intraday lows after a volatile trading session, as investors parsed through the higher-than-expected consumer prices report.

item.title: Consumer prices rose 0.2% in August as annual inflation rate hits lowest since early 2021
item.description: The consumer price index was expected to increase 0.2% in August and 2.6% from a year ago.

item.title: Harris says Trump 'sold us out on China': Highlights from the presidential debate on trade and tariffs
item.description: Trump defended his recent vow to increase trade duties, including blanket tariffs of 10% or 20% and additional tariffs of 60% to 100% on China.

item.title: 'Economy class syndrome' is a medical issue that can happen on flights — no matter where you sit
item.description: Deep vein thrombosis can be a serious health issue that strikes at any time. But medium-to long-haul flights increase the risk of developing it.

item.title: China's AI models lag their U.S. counterparts by 6 to 9 months, says former head of Google China
item.description: Chinese artificial intelligence models may be at least half a year behind those made in the U.S., said Kai-Fu Lee, former head of Google China.

item.title: Norfolk Southern CEO Alan Shaw replaced by CFO after alleged affair with legal chief
item.description: Norfolk Southern CEO Alan Shaw is out effective immediately and will be replaced by finance chief Mark George.

item.title: Britain labels data centers critical infrastructure to boost cyber defenses
item.description: The British government said Thursday that U.K. data centers will be given "Critical National Infrastructure" designation.

item.title: Trump Media shares sink to new post-merger low after presidential debate
item.description: Republican nominee Donald Trump is the majority owner of Trump Media, which operates the social media platform Truth Social and trades as DJT on the Nasdaq.

item.title: Bill Gates shares the single-minded attitude he used to grow Microsoft: I focused my life 'just on the one job'
item.description: When Bill Gates co-founded Microsoft at age 20, he wasn't thinking about becoming a billionaire. Here's the one thing he single-mindedly focused on, instead.

item.title: Caroline Ellison seeks to duck prison sentence for role in FTX collapse
item.description: Caroline Ellison's lawyers are pushing for no prison time ahead of the former Alameda Research CEO's Sept. 24 sentencing.

item.title: Chairman of property firm Damac expresses concerns over 'expensive' Dubai
item.description: Increasing demand for property, especially in the luxury space, is boosting prices not just of homes but of everything else in Dubai.

item.title: This government-backed startup is growing blood to help fight shortages
item.description: Safi Biotherapeutics, a government-backed startup, is growing blood in a lab to help fight shortages.

item.title: Trump tariff threats will trigger import 'rush,' say trade experts, and consumers pay the price
item.description: Donald Trump doubled down on new tariffs during Tuesday's presidential debate, but trade experts say consumers should be worried about paying the price.

item.title: European Central Bank set to cut interest rates just days before the Fed's big decision
item.description: Traders are widely anticipating an interest rate cut at the Federal Reserve's Sept. 17-18 meeting, as well as at the ECB's meeting this week.

item.title: Commerzbank shares jump 20% after UniCredit buys 4.5% stake from the German government
item.description: Commerzbank shares jumped on market open on Wednesday, after Italian bank UniCredit acquired a 4.5% stake in the Frankfurt-based lender from German government.

item.title: Huawei launches $2,800 trifold phone hours after Apple debuts iPhone 16
item.description: The Mate XT comes in red and black, in three storage options with prices ranging from 19,999 yuan ($2,809) to 23,999 yuan ($3,371).

item.title: This 29-year-old millionaire doesn’t own a home — here’s how he spends and invests his money instead
item.description: Timothy Armoo is not what you might expect from a multi-millionaire.

item.title: UK economy flatlines again in July, below expectations
item.description: U.K. economy remained flat in July, flash figures published from the Office for National Statistics showed Wednesday.

item.title: Berkshire unloads another chunk of Bank of America as CEO Moynihan lauds Buffett as great shareholder
item.description: Since mid-July, Berkshire Hathaway has sold more than 174.7 million shares of the Charlotte, North Carolina-based bank for $7.2 billion.

item.title: From the far right to fiscal challenges, France could lurch from one crisis to another
item.description: France finally has a prime minister, but its challenges are far from over.

item.title: Amazon makes £8 billion UK investment to build cloud and AI infrastructure
item.description: AWS competes with Microsoft and Google in the U.K. and its investment continues the company's focus on expansion in Europe.

item.title: European businesses in China reach a 'tipping point' on whether to invest more
item.description: European businesses in China have grown so discouraged that Beijing must act if the companies are to invest further, the EU Chamber of Commerce in China said.

item.title: Ireland now needs to decide what it will do with 13 billion euros in back taxes from Apple
item.description: The decision comes at a time when Ireland is in the unusual position of running a budget surplus of several billion euros.

item.title: Asia markets faltered with Japan's Nikkei leading losses on week-long losing streak
item.description: Traders in Asia parsed the Reuters Tankan business sentiment survey from Japan, South Korea unemployment data and the U.S. presidential debate.

item.title: Seven & i Holdings' shares slide 3% on likely U.S. probe into a potential M&A deal with Couche-Tard
item.description: Shares of Seven & i Holdings slid following news that the FTC has reportedly informed that they might investigate a possible deal with Alimentation Couche-Tard.

item.title: Japanese wage growth to surpass inflation for the first time in over 30 years, says asset management firm
item.description: "The past three decades in Japan have been defined by minimal price inflation and negligible wage growth," said Yuko Iizuka, economist at Asset Management One.

item.title: Rapper Ye is set to perform a controversial show in China this week — and many are wondering why
item.description: Some are wondering if tourism revenue and a desire for international recognition are at the heart of China's decision to allow Ye to perform in Hainan.

item.title: After success in Paris, Los Angeles looks to elevate Olympic Games in 2028
item.description: The Los Angeles 2028 Games are aiming to leave the city better off after the Olympics leave, key stakeholders said at CNBC x Boardroom’s Game Plan.

item.title: Cautious Chinese travelers are taking more last-minute trips as economy struggles
item.description: Chinese travelers are taking more last-minute trips as they become more cautious with spending amid lackluster economic recovery.

item.title: Sony unveils upgraded PlayStation 5 Pro to boost slowing console business
item.description: Sony on Tuesday unveiled an upgraded version of its PlayStation 5 console, called the PlayStation 5 Pro.
